dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 7272 IH: Feed Hungry Veterans Act of 2022
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Hayes (for herself, Mr. Scott of Virginia, and Mrs. Radewagen) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to expand the eligibility of disabled veterans to receive supplemental nutrition assistance program benefits.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Feed Hungry Veterans Act of 2022.
The Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2011 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by amending subparagraph (A) to read as follows:
one service-connected disability which is rated at 60 percent or higher under title 38, United States Code; or
two or more service-connected disabilities, at least one of which is rated at 40 percent or higher and the combined rating is 70 percent or higher under such title;
by inserting after subparagraph (B) the following:
has a determination of being catastrophically disabled under such title; or
is under the age of 65 and receiving a pension under section 1521 of such title;
by striking or (F) and inserting (F), and
by inserting before the period at the end the following:

quoted-block.quoted-block-continuation-text: ; or (G) a veteran described in subparagraph (A), (B), (C), or (D) of section 3(j)(4)

section.text: This Act, and the amendments made by this Act, shall take effect on October 1, 2022.
